episode_title: 419 - The One With All The Haste

content.description: Rachel’s bedroom; Rachel is awoken by a man singing in the next apartment.

content.speaker: The Singing Man
content.text: Morning’s here! Sunshine is here! The sky is clear, the morning’s here! The morning’s here!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: HEY!! Do you have to do that? It’s Saturday!

content.speaker: The Singing Man
content.text: Oh come on! Morning’s here! (Starts singing) Morning’s here! The morning is here! Sunshine is here!
(Rachel slams shut her window and storms into the living room, where Joey and Monica are eating breakfast.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I hate this apartment! I hate the color of these walls! I hate the fact that this place still smells like bird! I hate that singing guy!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you kidding? I love that guy! (Starts singing) Morning’s here! Morning is here—

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Stop it! I will kill you. I hate the fact that my room is so small.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, I have all the space I need. Just do what I did.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica, you don’t even have a bed, you sleep in a ball on the floor!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what? I am really tired of your bellyaching! Okay, I-I worked really hard at making this a nice place for us to live!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry. I’m so sorry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See, this is a great apartment.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Shut up! This place is a hole!

content.description: Ross’s bedroom; Ross and Emily are making out. Ross as a new feature.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh, blimey, I still can’t believe you’ve got an earring!
(Yep, it’s a little gold loop.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh? I know, I know. Who am I? David Bowe? (Shakes his head around, pretending like he’s jamming.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: He does that?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, I don’t know, whatever.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I think it makes you look really dangerous.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I know. Y’know what, I never would’ve gotten this if it weren’t for you. No really, when I’m with you I’m-I’m like this whole other guy, I love that guy! I mean, I love you too, a lot, but that guy! I-I love that guy!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I love both of you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah?
(They kiss.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I wish I didn’t have to go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Then don’t. Stay here. Just don’t go so soon to London, just one more day.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ohh, Ross, please!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: One more day, seriously/

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Don’t do this to me, again. You’d know I’d stay here in a minute, but I’d really miss so much work, they’ll fire me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, then you can stay as long as you want.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I wish I could.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh no. Don’t, don’t, don’t start packing. Come on! (She puts some clothes into her bag, and Ross throws them out.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I don’t think you understand packing. Look, I just don’t want to leave it to the last minute. Last time I left in such a rush, I left my knickers here.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I know, I uh, I tried them on.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: You didn’t!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. No, I didn’t. I didn’t want to be that guy.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, Joey and Chandler are watching one of those Kung Fu movies and imitating the moves.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hello!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ho! Ho! Ho!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Excuse me.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Your pants!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah! You like ‘em? I just, I went to a used clothes store and got a bunch of maternity stuff. These are sooo comfortable!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, Pheebs, those are uh, those are Santa pants.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Santa pants. (Phoebe still doesn’t get it.) Santa Claus’s pants.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nuh-uh! They’re maternity pants. They even came with a list of baby names. (Pulls out a sheet of paper which lists who’s been naughty and who’s been nice.) See, these names are good, and these names are bad. (Finally, she figures it out.) Ohh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So—Hey, Pheebs! So, how are the elves?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know! How are the-the-the-the, y’know—You’re clothes aren’t funny.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, guys, what-what should I wear to a Knicks game?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uhh, a T-shirt that says, “I don’t belong here.”

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You have Knicks tickets?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, my mom got my dad’s season tickets in the divorce, so she just gave them to me.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, apparently, they’re pretty good seats.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh my God! Those are almost right on the floor!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do you guys want these?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah we do!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, well you got ‘em.

content.speaker: Both
content.text: All right!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Just give us our apartment back!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Boy! I didn’t see that coming!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you serious?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, come on! We know what these are worth.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, what, do you think we’re stupid?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You’re not stupid. You’re meaner than I thought.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What do you say?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Forget it! Okay, I’m not giving up my bachelor pad for some basketball seats!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re bachelor pad?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Have you even had a girl up here?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. But uh, Joey has, and I usually talk to them in the morning time.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, you do!

content.description: Central Perk, Joey is whining to Chandler about the tickets.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, Gunther, can I get two cups of chino, please?

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Good one.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on, season tickets! Season tickets, do you know what that means?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Forget it! Okay, I’m not giving up the apartment.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh come—look, when I was a kid my dad’s company gave season tickets to the number one salesman every year, all right? My dad never won! Of course, he wasn’t in the sales division, but still, I never ever, ever forgot that!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, guys! (They both notice his new little friend)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: We don’t make enough fun of you already?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh yeah, Emily convinced me to do it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You do know that Wham broke up?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I like it, and Emily likes it, and that’s what counts. So uh, how are you guys doing?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh-no, don’t try and talk all normal with that thing in your ear.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Where is Emily?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ugh, she’s saying good-bye to her uncle.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Man, didn’t she like just get here?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah!! Yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Easy tiger.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I just, I hate this so much! I mean, every time I go pick her up at the airport, it’s-it’s so great. But at the same time I’m thinking, “Well, I’m gonna be right back there in a couple of days, dropping her off.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So what are you going to do?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nothing! There’s nothing to do! I mean, she lives there, I live here. I mean, she-she’d have to uh, move here. She should move here!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I could ask her to live with me!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you serious?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I mean, why not! I mean, I mean why not?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Because you’ve only known her for six weeks! Okay, I’ve got a carton of milk in my fridge I’ve had a longer relationship with!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look guys, when I’m with her it’s-it’s-it’s like she brings this-this-this great side out of me. I mean I-I-I love her, y’know?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And I love the milk! But, I’m not gonna some British girl to move in with me! (Realizes that made no sense.) Joey, you say things now.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right look, Ross, he’s right. Emily’s great, she’s great! But this way too soon, you’re only gonna scare her!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t want to do that.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No! You don’t want to wreck it, you don’t want to go to fast!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, no, you’re right, I know, you’re right, I’m not, I’m not gonna do it. All right, thanks guys. (Gets up to leave.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, no problem, just remember to wake us up before you go-go.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s erm, Chandler and Joey’s, later that same day. Joey and Chandler are eating pizza, and Phoebe is trying to knit something.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s too hard. Too hard!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right boys, last chance for the tickets!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Or I’ll give them to my new boyfriend, Joshua.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No thank you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wait-wait-wait-wait! (To Chandler) Come on! Come on, let’s trade! The timing’s perfect, I just clogged the toilet!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, I want those basketball seats as much as you do! Okay, but we can’t leave in the small apartment after we’ve lived here! Didn’t you ever read Flowers for Algernon ?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yes! Didn’t you ever read Sports Illustrated ?! No! I didn’t read yours! But come on, we can go to the game tonight!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, the only way I will even consider this is if they offer a lot more than just season seats.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It’s the Knicks!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Screw the Knicks!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I didn’t mean that. I just meant that the apartment is worth so much more.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Huh.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And the Knicks rule all.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, the Knicks rule all!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, so? Are you gonna do it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No. No. We’re not gonna do that, y’know why? Because its not an even trade.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, okay, look, what if you could keep the apartment and get the tickets?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Done!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Let me finish.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m talking about a bet, winner takes all.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, we could end up with nothing.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Or you could end up with everything.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh, I like that.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, so what do you say?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, just do it!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Op, op, I’m convinced!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on man, you know I’d do it for you! Because, you’re my best friend.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, but you can’t use that again for a whole year. I’m in.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, this is so exciting! Ooh, God, what are you going to bet?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, okay, well, I think we should let Phoebe decide, because she’s the only who’s impartial, and she’s so pretty.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. Umm, ooh, ooh—oh, I have a game!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: This is great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What’s the game?! What’s the game?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, well, it doesn’t have a name—oh, okay, Phoebeball! No, it doesn’t have a name. Umm, okay, Monica, what is your favourite thing about trees?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They’re green?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Good! Good! Five points!
(They both rejoice; Chandler is totally confused.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, Joey, same question.
(He looks to Chandler, who doesn’t have a clue.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uhh, they’re tall.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, three points. Both fine answers, but we were looking for leafy, leafy.
(Joey turns and is angry that Chandler didn’t come up with the answer.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s not even a game!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What? Shut up! We’re winning!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You wanna finish this right now? All right, we get a deck of cards, high card wins. What do you say?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fine, let’s do it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I have cards!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, good.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah! Here! (She grabs a deck out of her purse) Oh no, these are the trick deck. Okay. Here yes. Okay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, you guys uh, you guys pick first

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (She picks a card.) Four.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s a low one!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Okay. (Joey picks a card.) Phoebe, you look, I can’t.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What make you think I can?! (Shields her eyes from it.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. Okay. (He looks at the card.) Ace!
(Both Joey and Chandler and Monica and Rachel jump up and down for joy.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why are you screaming and hugging?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because we won our apartment back!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? Ace is high! Jack, queen, king, ace!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! Ace is low! Ace, two, three, four!
(They all look to Phoebe to settle this.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I don’t know. Ooh! Ooh! Look it! (She fans out the trick deck.) Ah-ha!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, cut, let’s pick again, pick again.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on apartment! Come on apartment! (Picks a card.) Oh! I know queen is high!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh-huh, not as high as…(picks a card) It worked! King!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah baby!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But, we pick again! We pick again!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t know!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Tickets please! (Rachel hands over the tickets) That’s courtside baby!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Seriously, good game though. Good game. (He tries to congratulate them, but they pull away.) (To Chandler) What are they so mad about? They get the apartment back!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No they didn’t!

content.description: Ross’s apartment, Emily has packed as Ross returns.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I packed while you were gone. I left some knickers under your pillow.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Move in with me.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Don’t be scared, I-I know it sounds crazy and-and people will say it’s too soon, but just-just think, think how great it will be.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ohh, no. Ugh. Oh, leaving London, my whole family lives there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: My job!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, so, you-you’ll get a job here! I mean, I’m always hearing about uh, them foreigners coming in here and stealing American jobs; that could be you!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Yeah, but it-it-it’s my whole life—you come to England.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I can’t. I would, I really would, but my son is here; I can’t leave him. Isn’t—you don’t think there’s any way?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ohh, I don’t think so. I mean it would be different if it was way into the future —and-and-and we were getting married or something.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh no, no, right I shouldn’t have said married. Uh, please don’t go freaky on me. I didn’t mean it. Well, I didn’t say it; I take it back!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, don’t. Why don’t we?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Why don’t we what?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Get married.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: You are mad!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No! I’m not! It’s-it’s-it’s perfect! I mean it’s better than you just-just moving here, ‘cause it’s us together forever, and that’s-that’s what I want.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: We’ve only known each other for six weeks!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, I know, so what? I mean, who’s-who’s to say? Does that me we-we can’t do it? Look, huh, I was with Carol for four years before we got married and I wound up divorced from a pregnant lesbian. I mean, this, this makes sense for us. Come on! I mean, on our first date we ended up spending the whole weekend in Vermont! I mean, last night I got my ear pierced! Me! This feels right. Doesn’t it?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: My parents are going to be really mad.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is that—are you saying yes? Is that yes?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Yes.
(They kiss and hug.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes! We’re getting married?!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: We’re getting married!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come here, come here. Uh, (He takes the earring out.) ow! Emily, will you marry me?

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Yes.
(He tries to put it on her finger.)

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Ohh, it’s a bit small.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Damn! I thought that was going to be romantic as hell!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: It was.
(They kiss.)

content.description: The hallway, Joey and Chandler are coming back from the game.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Those were like the best seats ever.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah. Hey! Should we give these shirts to the girls? Y’know, kinda like a peace offering.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, that’s very nice. Plus, y’know they were free and they’re too small.

(He knocks on the girls’ door and walks in. Surprise! The girls, obviously using Star Trek technology, have completely moved everything in both apartments back to their original positions, all in the time it took for the guys to go to a basketball game. Wow! Anyhoo, Chandler is stunned, and Joey doesn’t even realise it.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh. Oh, God! (He starts running around like a chicken with his head cut off.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, want a beer? (Hands him a beer and sits down in one of the chairs.) (Jumping up.) WHOA!!!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I KNOW!!!
(They both sprint to what used to be their apartment.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Open up! Open up! Open up!
(A very angry Monica opens the door with the security chain still on.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We’ll discuss it, in the morning! (Slams the door shut.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What the hell is going on?!
(It’s Rachel’s turn to open the door.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We took our apartment back!! (Slams the door shut.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I had nothing to do with it. (Closes the door.) (Opens the door.) Okay, it was my idea, but I don’t feel good about it.
(She goes to close the door, but Chandler puts his foot it in.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We are switching back, right now!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, we’re not! We’re not leaving!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, you’re gonna have to leave sometime, because you both have jobs, and as soon as you do, we’re switching it back! There’s nothing you can do to stop us! Right, Joe?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t want to move again!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t care, this is our apartment! And they stole—you stole it—our apartment, and we won that apartment fair and square, twice! And I am getting it back right now. I’m getting back right now!
(They open the door.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right. We figured you might respond this way, so we have a backup offer.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh no-no-no, no more offers. You can’t offer anything to us!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Let us keep the apartment and…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: As a thank you, Rachel and I will kiss for one minute.
[Time lapse. The guys are entering their apartment.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Totally worth it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That was one good minute!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Good night.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good night.
(They both go back into their old rooms and shut the doors. Of course, Chandler has to close both sections of his door.)
[Cut to the girls apartment.]

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Men are such idiots.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah! Can you believe that something that stupid actually got us our apartment back?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s so funny to think if you’d just done that right after the last contest, no one would have had to move at all.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, let-let-let’s pretend that’s not true.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, scarf’s done. (It’s not really a scarf, it’s just a bunch of yarn that Phoebe has tied together. Just then, Ross and Emily enter dragging with them Joey and Chandler.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on! Come on. Come on.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What-what’s going on?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross has some big thing to tell everyone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uhh, okay, it’s uh, Emily and I, we decided to uh, to get married.
(The gang is stunned.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What? Oh, are you pregnant too?!

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: Umm, no.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: When, when did—how, how did you…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We, we just decided to uh, to go for it.

content.speaker: Emily
content.text: I mean, we know it’s a bit hasty but, uh, it just feels so right, so…
(Rachel slowly walks in from her bedroom. She is stunned speechless.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Umm, uh, I was just telling the guys…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I-I heard. (Pause, everyone looks at each other, waiting for Rachel’s reaction.) I think it’s great! (Hugs Ross.) Ohh, I’m so happy for you!
(Seeing Rachel’s apparently okay with this, the rest of the gang jumps up to congratulate Ross and Emily on their pending nuptials.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, well, that’s great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Yeah!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe you’re getting married!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. (They hug again.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Monica and Rachel made out. (Giggles like a schoolboy and Monica glares at him.)

content.description: Joey’s bedroom, he is awoken by the singing guy.

content.speaker: The Singing Man
content.text: Morning’s here! The morning’s here!
(Joey joins him.)

content.speaker: Both
content.text: Sunshine is here! The sky is clear, the morning’s here!

content.speaker: The Singing Man
content.text: Hey! You’re back!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! (Singing) Get into gear!

content.speaker: The Singing Man
content.text: Breakfast is near!

content.speaker: Both
content.text: The dark of night has disappeared!!

content.speaker: The Singing Man
content.text: I’ll see you tomorrow morning!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay!
